page.title: 10HUMBER GROWERS - FARMING
page.content: The company was formed in 1961 as a co_operative of local growers. It covers 150 acres of computer controlled heated glass houses, producing 34 million cucumbers beween February and October 1984, and 860,000 lettuces between November 1984 and January 1985. Heating is in the process of being converted from oil to coal, at an estimated yearly saving of Â£1.25 million. Other salad crops are produced on a relatively small scale throughout the year. Produce is supplied to most major cities in Britain, including the large supermarket chains of Sainsburys, Tesco, Marks & Spencer, Littlewoods, and Argyle. To meet all year demands, Humber Growers have recently developed links with continental countries and are now expanding their fruit and vegetable interests.
